definition: full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]

sentences.english: Do not expect too much of him.
I am well aware of the expectations that accompany my presidency around the world.
sentences.chinese: 我深知全世界对我就任总统的瞩望。

sentences.english: Farmers plough and sow in prospect of the harvest.
sentences.chinese: 农民耕田播种，瞩望于收获。

sentences.english: He is the hope of his school.
Do not expect too much of (from) him.

definition: to look far ahead/to look forward (to)
to raise one's head and look into the distance/fig. to forward to/to long for
to expect/to look forward to/anxious for sth/to hope (to get sth)
to gaze at/to stare fixedly at
to raise one's head and look
to survey the scene from an elevated position
to miss/to long for/to remember with longing/yearning
